issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: No warning is given, no attempt to merge policies. The former seems appropriate.
fields.summary: creating new policy with same name as existing policy overwrites old policy

comments.body:
Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/640

Note that a modal dialog is displayed when there is a policy name conflict.  The modal won't appear again for the page if the "I understand the risks" button is clicked.  Screenshot attached.

Looking good! A couple of comments:

Modal should continue to appear even if the "I understand the risks" button is clicked". To provide a way to not display the modal again, please use the "Do not show me this again" checkbox instead.

Also, button text should be title case please. Thanks!

[~jloza]: Do we want the "do not show me this again" checkbox to be scoped to the page (i.e. for the given policy), or should it be scoped to the browser session (i.e. don't show me this kind of warning for this or any other policy for this session)?

HI [~kgill], I think, actually, neither. Can we scope it so that if they click the do not show me again checkbox it never shows again for that user, for this or any other policy, across sessions...just never? Is that possible? If it keeps popping up every time I overwrite a policy with the same name, after I've said I know what I'm doing and please quit showing me this, just because my session expired and I re-logged-in, I would be super annoyed. What do you think?
[~jloza] ok, we can persist the do-not-show-again setting in the user-agent in localStorage, which will last across sessions.  I will make that change and resubmit for review.
Updated pull request 640 to add the "don't show me again" option for the warning.

[~kgill] I think something is wrong, not sure what it is. I am on mac osx 10.9.2, FF 29. Cleared cache. 

I created the policy with the same name and different contents 3 times for the group new-group in acct 03/admin user on the dev cloud with the latest pulled from develop and I cannot get the message to display?

Saw the modal box now the first time through, so that works, yay!

Although, I closed the box with the close button and clicked save policy again and it just saved it, no warning dialog at all (checkbox was unchecked). 

Also, button text is still sentence case, should be title case. 

Thanks!
[~jloza] Hmm, need to clarify when we want the modal to display.  Should it be when clicking Save changes, when entering the conflicting name (--how its currently implemented), or both?
[~kgill] on submit ought to be fine for now.

[~kgill] Looks good, thank you! 

I pushed a change to your PR, where I fixed the text on the button so that it is true sentence case (the word "the" should not be capitalized in sentence case). Because this is text on a button, I was not sure if my change would have impact to the test case, so I have not merged the PR yet. [~alice] do I need to update something if I changed a Big T to a little t on a button?

Thanks!

verified dialog displays properly. 

Verified on mac osx 10.9.2, FF 29
